author: Pavan Dahat
text:
The tribal activist is not cooperating with police team, says Kalluri

Bastar Inspector General of Police S.R.P. Kalluri on Sunday claimed that tribal activist and Aam Aadmi Party leader Soni Sori was never “critically injured” as reported in the media.

The controversial officer, against whom Ms. Sori was trying to file a complaint of “intimidation” before she was attacked on February 19, also said the tribal activist was not “cooperating” with a three-member police team appointed by him to probe the attack.

“As part of the investigation into the alleged attack on Ms. Sori, the Special Investigation Team led by IPS officer Kalyan Elesela reached the Apollo Hospitals in Sarita Vihar, New Delhi on February 27. But the SIT could not meet Ms. Sori as she has adopted a hostile approach towards the investigating team,” Mr. Kalluri said in a statement.

“Our team met the doctor who is treating Ms. Sori in New Delhi and it was found that she was never in a critical state as reported in the media. She is under treatment to prevent infection in the face and she does not require any plastic surgery. She was admitted with irritation caused due to unknown substance. The traces of that substance have been sent for forensic analysis by the police,” he added.
title: Soni Sori was never critically injured: Bastar IG
